Text: This is pretty cool: text "books" to 99234 and I'll send you updates about what I'm reading. I'm calling this the #BennetBookshelf and I'm excited for you to be a part of it.

üö® üö® @NRDC_Action joined our campaign today. They're focused on protecting our environment, and so am I. That's why I helped pass legislation to protect our public lands, invest in wildfire resilience, and plug orphan wells that leak dangerous gases. https://t.co/N4S1Mp29ax

On this day in 1942, FDR signed his executive order sending Japanese Americans to internment camps. There was one here in CO and this week, the House and Senate passed my bill to make it part of our National Park system so we can pay tribute to this dark moment in our history.

Today I'd like to highlight Madam CJ Walker who was an entrepreneur, philanthropist, and activist - and Denver resident. She was also the first female self-made millionaire in America. She made her fortune by developing hair care products for black women. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/MwMPEeyd13

My bill to establish Amache, Colorado's Japanese internment camp during WWII, as part of the National Park system is on its way to the president's desk to be signed into law. This is an important step towards learning from and honoring this dark moment in our history.
Coloradans should never have to choose between paying for food or paying for insulin. https://t.co/n4BfKrDjJp

Today, we introduced a bill to cap the cost of insulin. The skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs is unacceptable. No one should have to ration their insulin or worry about whether they can afford it. This bill is a step towards lowering costs for Coloradans.
Sign up today for our new texting program and I can send you updates about this campaign, right to your phone. Just text "Bennet" to 99234!

Two weeks until caucuses begin. This is the process by which candidates, like me, get on the ballot so Coloradans can vote for us in November. Would you caucus on behalf of Colorado Democrats in your home county? Click for more information and to sign up: https://t.co/tRA9DCriDk

Thanks, Joe. Couldn‚Äôt have done it without you. Last night the Senate passed our bill to add Amache, a former Japanese internment camp, to the National Park System, a huge step towards it becoming law. https://t.co/WGgki1zglK

Four years ago today, a gunman opened fire at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, killing 17 and wounding 17. I'm ashamed that because of dysfunction in Washington, DC, this generation is growing up in the shadow of gun violence. It's time for universal background checks.
Happy Valentine's Day - a few pictures of me and my valentine! https://t.co/CgUhdoAmEp

What I'm Reading: Invisible Child: Poverty, Survival & Hope in an American City by Andrea Elliott follows a homeless child's journey for 8 yrs. I refuse to accept that children are the poorest people in America. We can change this with policies like the expanded Child Tax Credit.

I've secured funding we need for forest restoration and recovery in our national forests that have been affected by recent wildfires. It's more important than ever that we ensure our communities have the resources they need to protect our landscape for future generations.

We cannot lose sight of reinstating the expanded Child Tax Credit, or the more than 3 million kids we kept out of poverty last year alone.

https://t.co/LKSDbqL5bN

I pushed for at-home Covid-19 tests to be covered by Medicare - now they will be. Seniors and individuals with disabilities who rely on Medicare are at a higher risk of severe illness from Covid-19 and will now have access to free, at-home rapid Covid-19 tests.

Colorado's Medicaid program serves more than 1.4 million low-income Coloradans who often face voting challenges. To make it easier and safer for everyone to vote, I'm working to allow Medicaid enrollees to be automatically registered to vote, so we can ease this burden.

3 of the biggest wildfires in Colorado history tore through our state in 2020. We know more are coming. That's why I fought to secure funding for forest restoration and recovery in the Arapaho & Roosevelt, Routt, and White River National Forests.

In less than one month, Colorado Democrats will begin caucusing in their hometown counties to support candidates and play an active role in our democracy. Are you interested in being a part of it? 

Click here for more information and to sign up: https://t.co/tRA9DCriDk
Join me in wishing my friend and counterpart in the Senate @hickenlooper a very happy birthday! There's no one else who could get me to play a cowbell on camera. https://t.co/a7Rxhb304m
As the Winter Olympics kick off this week, wishing the best of luck to our American athletes. Fun fact: Colorado has the second highest number of athletes representing America this year!

Colorado has 625 abandoned wells. These unplugged wells leak methane, which contributes to climate change. I secured funding to plug these wells, which will create good-paying jobs, help us fight climate change, and restore wildlife habitat.

Meet Dr. Justina Ford, today's #BlackHistoryMonth Hero and Denver‚Äôs first licensed Black woman doctor. Dr. Ford wasn‚Äôt allowed to practice in a hospital, but that didn't stop her. She set up a private practice in her home and treated anyone regardless of race, class, or gender. https://t.co/l5mLQi2PI5
Congratulations Colorado, Punxsutawney Phil says we've got 6 more weeks of winter skiing. #GroundhogDay

As #BlackHistoryMonth begins today, I'm highlighting stories of Black Coloradans who moved our state forward. Meet Barney Ford. He escaped slavery, eventually settling in Denver where he started multiple businesses, while fighting for civil and voting rights for Black Coloradans. https://t.co/LIXTMhuRra
Happy Lunar New Year to those who celebrate. Wishing you and your loved ones great happiness and prosperity in this year of the Tiger. https://t.co/D0UHiLxTId

I read this and thought it was a beautiful novel, and a prescient reminder of just how pressing our fight against climate change is.

https://t.co/5TFPGpZlel

I bought this for my wife, Susan, for Christmas. I'll let you know what she thinks. 

https://t.co/t8ZCHclleS

Two more local authors, including David Heska Wanbli Weiden, a Lakota author!

https://t.co/6CM7FDgOgN

This is very cool, Michael. And you've got a great name, my friend. Highlighting a Colorado author here!

https://t.co/RkrIfzbNdI

I recently asked for reading recommendations and you all sent me some amazing ones. Wanted to share a few highlights here.

#BennetBookshelf https://t.co/TXJ05qNJoB

The Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, the first bill I ever voted for as Senator, was signed into law on this day by President Obama. 30 minutes after being sworn in, I rushed to the Senate floor to vote for fair pay and I'll keep fighting for fair pay until we reach true pay equity.
Join me in wishing my daughter Halina a happy 21st birthday! I can't wait to see how you'll change the world, Halina. https://t.co/1ZcdNcCCwe

ICYMI: this week we were endorsed by @GabbyGiffords and @GiffordsCourage. Colorado is all too familiar with the devastating impacts of gun violence. I'll never stop fighting to keep our communities safer.
I‚Äôm endorsing @pettersen4co because I know she‚Äôll fight for our Colorado values. Brittany, I look forward to fighting alongside you. #copolitics #CO07 https://t.co/Nq5AhyfuAI

On this day in 2017, Trump signed an Executive Order that would come to be known as the Muslim Ban. We have a lot of work to undo Trump's damage and I'm working every day in Washington to do just that.

77 yrs ago today, Auschwitz, the largest, deadliest Nazi concentration camp, was liberated. My mother and grandmother are Polish Jews who survived the Holocaust. Today, I honor them and all those who experienced these atrocities, we'll never forget. 

#HolocaustRemembranceDay https://t.co/EtOqVvqoYQ

@GabbyGiffords @GiffordsCourage Columbine was right before my oldest daughter was born. She's now 22. Her generation has grown up in the shadow of gun violence. They bear the burden of a national government that did nothing to protect them. That's why I'm fighting for common sense gun violence legislation. 2/2

Big announcement: @GabbyGiffords and @GiffordsCourage have endorsed our campaign! It means a lot to have their endorsement of my work to pass universal background checks and close the boyfriend loophole. But we have to do more. 1/2 https://t.co/NRWDbjUWiN

49 years ago, Shirley Chisholm began her historic run for president making her the 1st African American to run for a major party‚Äôs presidential nomination and 1st woman to run for the Dem party‚Äôs nomination. Her political legacy has paved the way for so many who came after her.

Many Coloradans lost all of their possessions in the Marshall Fire. I asked U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services to waive fees for their replacement documents, like visas and green cards. Now, USCIS has confirmed they'll waive these fees.

49 years ago today, the Supreme Court ruled in favor of "Jane Roe," creating the decision we know today as Roe v. Wade. Those hard-earned rights are still under attack nationwide. We must pass the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act to codify this decision.

That's why I don't take a cent from corporate PACs or federal lobbyists. I believe my campaign needs to lead by example.

3/3

I've spent years leading the fight to overturn Citizens United, ban partisan gerrymandering, and block Members of Congress from ever becoming lobbyists. 

2/3

12 years ago today, the Citizens United decision gave billionaires an unfair advantage over the American people in our country's politics. Since then, American politics has been flooded with ungodly amounts of cash and inaction on the issues that matter most to Americans.

1/3

It's time to lift the ban on gay and bisexual men giving blood. It's a discriminatory policy that stigmatizes the LGBTQ community. We can fix our national blood shortage by allowing everyone to give blood.

More here: https://t.co/84pyayG47g

Flying home to Denver later. As you know, I prefer to read on my flights rather than watch movies or TV, after I finish my work. Got any good book recommendations for me?

#BennetBookshelf

Colorado has 481 bridges in poor condition. The bipartisan infrastructure law I fought for is bringing funding to Colorado to fix our bridges and create good jobs all over the state. We can make it easier and safer for Coloradans to get to school and work every day.

What I'm Reading: been reading How The Word Is Passed: A Reckoning With the History Of Slavery Across America. Clint Smith traveled the country visiting monuments and landmarks and uncovering the hidden history of slavery. This book is important reading for all of us.

I heard from grocery store workers with @UFCW_7 on the picket line this afternoon about their fight for fair and safe working conditions. Everyone deserves to be safe at work, and fairly compensated. https://t.co/R0qx0wpTst
Today, I spoke at the Marade in honor of Dr. MLK, Jr. and his legacy. We continue his work today: protecting and strengthening our democracy for every single American. https://t.co/U6ksiczhsD

I‚Äôm still fighting to extend the expanded Child Tax Credit that kept 4 million kids out of poverty last year because we can‚Äôt let parents and kids down by giving up the fight. https://t.co/TgGdnMR0WS
This campaign is truly powered by small dollar contributions from people all over Colorado, and it shows. Grateful to have you all on this team with us. https://t.co/dEwgjhfFr7
I don't usually read fiction, but just finished Jonathan Franzen's Crossroads. Have you read any good novels lately?

I'll be supporting legislation to protect voting rights when it goes through the Senate because protecting voting rights is critical to our democracy. Strengthening our democracy is the fight of our lifetimes

Too many families in Colorado are struggling with the cost of living right now. We've doubled the resources available to help Colorado families cover their energy bills this winter. No family should have to worry about how they're going to keep their families safe and warm.
Thank you, Ed. It's been a privilege to represent Colorado with you. https://t.co/KUdATJTk25
Yesterday, I joined @joebiden and state leaders in Boulder County as we begin to heal and rebuild from the Marshall Fire. https://t.co/13hoq4lDEy

Thank you, @CancerResrch. My legislation created a program to speed up the development of treatments for life-threatening illnesses, like cancer. Today, more than 140 prescription drugs have received breakthrough designation. https://t.co/8Qc61APDDy

Usually I tell you about the books I'm reading, but today, I'm sharing with you the books I gave to Susan, Caroline, Halina, and Anne for Christmas. If you've read any of these, reply here and lmk what you thought. https://t.co/vicLVtShfd
Wanted to share some of my thoughts with you today, on the one year anniversary of the January 6th insurrection. https://t.co/3R0F69dat7

Make no mistake: one year ago today, our democracy suffered a near death experience. I will spend the rest of my days fighting to protect our democracy. It is the work of our lifetimes.

Read more: https://t.co/qyF9JG455Y
My legislation to ban surprise medical bills went into effect this weekend. This will protect Americans from surprise bills and unexpected costs after medical emergencies: https://t.co/XZn4Qwq4Jf

Here are other organizations helping Boulder County families:

If you're looking for ways to help our neighbors in the aftermath of the Boulder County fires, here are a few: 

1/3

My thoughts are with the families in Boulder County who are evacuating this afternoon and our firefighters who are fighting these fires. Stay strong.

If you‚Äôre in Boulder, Superior, Louisville, and Lafayette, follow @BoulderOEM for updates.
Anything you chip in before our end-of-year deadline tomorrow goes directly towards holding onto our very slim Senate majority next year: https://t.co/driESuSYwI https://t.co/wtFQwEItuu
Harry Reid fought tirelessly for Nevada; his service and commitment to his state were always clear. I feel lucky to have worked with him. https://t.co/p98wyJGa15
What is the tax cut for working families I fought to expand for 6 years that kept nearly 4 million kids out of poverty in November alone? https://t.co/h3FKpwLkcw

Everywhere I go in Colorado, I hear about how our country's mental health crisis is only getting worse. That's why I was glad to announce Colorado will receive $2 million+ to implement an updated National Suicide Prevention Hotline.
Happy first day of Kwanzaa for those who celebrate the holiday. I hope it's filled with joy, prosperity, and reflection. https://t.co/17s8xwh1YP

Merry Christmas from the Bennet family to each of you who celebrate. I hope you enjoy time with friends and family today, even if you're celebrating differently because of Covid. It's the season to be together, whether by Zoom, outside, or boosted and in person.
Wishing everyone who celebrates a warm and relaxing Christmas Eve. Seasons greetings from my family to yours! https://t.co/nP5cTCiPQe

NEW DATA: the November installment of the expanded Child Tax Credit kept nearly 4 million kids nationwide out of poverty. The November payment alone contributed to a 5% decrease in child poverty. 

I will not stop fighting to make this program permanent. https://t.co/EetKFTKDm6

On my flights between DC and Denver recently, I've been reading The Curse of Bigness: Antitrust in the New Gilded Age by Tim Wu. A timely read about how corporate consolidation is influencing our democracy. Protecting and strengthening our democracy is the work of our lifetime.
Read my op-ed in The Colorado Sun today about why I have argued, for some time, 51 Senators need to be able to decide to pass legislation: https://t.co/mJ8wkLpnMU
It is time to change the filibuster to restore the Senate, protect democracy, and advance legislation on voting rights, abortion rights, gun violence prevention and more.
Yes, I am because poverty is a policy choice and I refuse to accept that our kids should remain in poverty. https://t.co/nxz7WfUeA6
We cannot let Coloradans like George and his family down. We have to extend the expanded Child Tax Credit that's already kept nearly 4 million kids out of poverty. https://t.co/IRNBDOlonN

Colorado is about to receive its first installments of funding for our highways, bridges, and 49 of our airports from the bipartisan infrastructure package I helped to pass. This is going to create jobs and bolster our economy.

What I'm Reading: A terrifying and important take on Trump's next coup. 

Our democracy suffered a near death experience on January 6th and the fight to protect it, has never been more important than it is right now: https://t.co/XXmxiU1PPC
Families are able to better support their kids with the monthly payments from the expanded Child Tax Credit. https://t.co/fEyisvqSrY
Studies show most parents used their monthly payments on necessities, and that food insecurity dropped by 24% after parents received these payments. https://t.co/aIekk44mR1

Colorado families pay an average of $12,000-$15,000/year for childcare. The expanded Child Tax Credit eases this burden, while I'm working to lower child care costs; we can attack this issue from all sides. https://t.co/CxN7n7J9lP https://t.co/yE49gENFgK
Our first story gets to the core of why we need the expanded Child Tax Credit: families are feeling secure in a way they haven't before. https://t.co/CxN7n7J9lP https://t.co/E4NmmfzczQ

Today, families are receiving their monthly Child Tax Credit payments. If we don't extend this program, it'll be the last one. I'm doing everything to ensure families don't lose this lifeline. Going to share stories with you here that make clear why we must extend this program.

On the anniversary of the Sandy Hook shooting that took 26 lives, including 20 children from us, we recommit to passing common sense gun violence prevention legislation, like universal background checks and closing the gun show loophole.

Flew back from Denver today. Finished Man's Search For Meaning about the author's experience in a Nazi concentration camp. This one was personal: my mother escaped the Holocaust. The author focuses on maintaining hope amid unimaginable tragedy. Important perspective.

This morning, the Supreme Court refused to block Texas‚Äôs dangerous abortion ban. If you‚Äôre feeling mad as hell right now, I‚Äôm there with you. Make no mistake: this is a further blow to abortion rights. We will not stand by. The Senate must pass the Women's Health Protection Act.

Families have been relying on the expanded Child Tax Credit to pay the rent, to buy groceries, to pay for a few hours of daycare so they can stay at work. We're fighting very hard not to disrupt it at the end of the year: https://t.co/J2D40OHpGV
You want me to let the wealthiest corporations avoid taxes? You mean the thing that gave us billionaire space toys?

Flew back to DC after a few days home in Colorado. Finished Native Son by Richard Wright on a recent flight. A look at growing up Black and poor in the early 20th century. Not enough has changed. Poverty is a policy choice. So we continue our work to lift people out of poverty.

I'm really excited about our new gear, launching in our online store today! If you're a climate voter, you'll want to check this out. Order by Friday and have it in time for Christmas: https://t.co/ACJpyboza2. https://t.co/RmMWdL30cU

Flew home to Denver today and finished @eosnos's new book "Wildland: The Making of America's Fury," where Osnos investigates the roots of political rage. We're passing legislation right now that will make peoples' lives easier by lowering costs, creating jobs, and cutting taxes.
Now is the time. https://t.co/m2aBGLJKVD

Joined NPR's @MorningEdition to talk about how we're finally investing in the American people and my fight to extend the expanded Child Tax Credit so families continue to receive this tax cut. Have a listen here: https://t.co/uxWkODQ7jK
On December 1, 1955, Rosa Parks was arrested for refusing to give up her seat on an Alabama bus. The Civil Rights Movement continues today and our work towards equity and equality is far from over.

The Supreme Court just heard a case about abortion rights that could have implications nationwide. We cannot ease up in the fight for reproductive freedom. We must pass the Women's Health Protection Act in the Senate + enshrine access to reproductive care into law once +
for all.

This #GivingTuesday I want to highlight @PPRockyMountain who's providing reproductive health care in Colorado and beyond. If you're looking to give a few dollars today, there couldn't be a more important moment to support an organization like this: https://t.co/5OZPFs7GQp
Thank you all for the well wishes for my birthday, I had a wonderful day with Susan and the girls. Now, back to work. https://t.co/M0jxm9VsGP

Susan here, Michael‚Äôs wife. Joining the girls on his Twitter to wish him a happy birthday! I took this picture of Michael along the Million Dollar Highway 27 years ago, a few months after we started dating. If you have a birthday message for Michael, RT this and share it with us! https://t.co/aEvs3UgBC9
Happy Hanukkah to all who celebrate! I hope you have nights of light and levity with your friends and family in the next 8 days.

Hi Twitter! It‚Äôs Caroline, Halina, and Anne - Michael‚Äôs daughters. It‚Äôs our dad‚Äôs birthday and we want your help wishing him a happy birthday! Our dad works hard fighting for Colorado, but he's always worked even harder to be present for us and we're so thankful for that. https://t.co/Vi7aXqVE2L
It's #SmallBusinessSaturday: what small business are you supporting today? I'm heading to @TatteredCover to pick up some new books for my flights, and maybe some Christmas gifts.

Today I'm thankful for Susan, our girls and for the 1-year extension of the expanded Child Tax Credit I'm fighting to pass so we continue these tax cuts for working families and get more kids out of poverty. https://t.co/6tm0MT0o3A

A bit of Bennet Family Thanksgiving tradition for you: every year we cook Madhur Jaffrey's recipes, incl her chicken vindaloo, which we've adapted into turkey vindaloo. I'll be cooking the bird tomorrow and if you're still looking for a turkey recipe, here's what I'll be using! https://t.co/GFzvlYN38i

NEW REPORT: More data showing parents receiving a tax cut in the form of monthly Child Tax Credit payments are using them for basic necessities like food, clothes, and bills. These payments are making day-to-day lives easier for parents across the country: https://t.co/OEYIFmOtcM

Today on Transgender Day of Remembrance we mourn the lives of trans folks, particularly trans women of color lost to deadly violence motivated by hate. Tomorrow we continue the fight to protect the trans community because everyone has the right to safely live an authentic life.

Child Tax Credit (Michael's Version)

Feat. @SherrodBrown @CoryBooker https://t.co/KxmogLIJow

The House just passed #BuildBackBetter which includes my provision to extend the expanded Child Tax Credit by one year. We also made sure to make it permanently refundable so kids in the poorest families are eligible for the full amount forever. We must seize this opportunity.
We're going to drive costs down for working families and make sure the wealthy and big corporations pay their fair share. https://t.co/LhccEMjEHi

Our bill to make Amache, a frmr Japanese internment camp in CO, part of the National Park Service just passed the Senate ENR committee. It‚Äôs one step closer to becoming law and I‚Äôll keep fighting till we get there. We must acknowledge and learn from this dark part of our history. https://t.co/H1LuOsOukx

Colorado had an enormous amount of influence in the drafting of both the infrastructure bill and the budget bill. I developed my provisions in Colorado, working with Republicans and Democrats in rural and urban parts of the state. Read more: https://t.co/4sTSNOsUST
We're going to create good-paying jobs all across Colorado, and nationwide, with the infrastructure bill we just passed.
Join me today at 4:30pm MT/6:30pm ET for a conversation with @DustiGurule, Executive Director of @coloractionfund. Follow me on Instagram at https://t.co/74jucSUJ8a and see you later today.

Tomorrow, I'll be joining @DustiGurule, Executive Director of @coloractionfund on Instagram Live for a convo abt reproductive rights + the work of creating economic opportunity for women of color. Join us at 4:30pm MT/6:30pm ET. Follow me so you're ready: https://t.co/74jucSUJ8a

Today, we signed the infrastructure bill into law and families are getting their next monthly payment of the expanded Child Tax Credit. This tax cut for working families has already kept more than 3 million kids out of poverty, this year alone.

As parents receive their next monthly payment of the expanded Child Tax Credit today, I want to share a story about how it's helped this parent in Englewood. Stories like these are why I'm fighting to extend this tax cut for working families for years to come. https://t.co/Tnpd6ipMba

Over a million Coloradans will be eligible for help affording their internet and tens of thousands of Coloradans who currently lack internet access, could gain it. And we can begin fixing the 481 bridges and more than 3,600 miles of Colorado highway in poor condition. 

4/4

This bipartisan bill is about improving the everyday lives of working Coloradans - creating good paying jobs and economic opportunity, making our roads and bridges safer, and expanding clean and affordable public transit, and flighting climate change while doing it. 

3/4

--fix Colorado's highways and bridges and expand public transportation 

--get broadband internet to Coloradans who don‚Äôt have it or can‚Äôt afford it

--improve water infrastructure and ensure access to clean water especially for Tribal communities  

2/4

THREAD: Just left the White House where Pres. Biden just signed the infrastructure bill into law. I've spent months fighting for this because it will work to: 

1/4

It‚Äôs quite simple: funding for road, bridge, and rail projects create good paying jobs in Colorado. That‚Äôs why I fought to get this done.

https://t.co/rV4JvZBiLK

Last month we introduced the Save Our Servicemembers Act to better protect our veterans and prevent military suicides. This nation's lifelong commitment to our veterans and servicemembers must remain exactly that - lifelong. #VeteransDay

What I'm Reading: The I-70/Vail Pass tops a list of 10 projects nationwide in need of legislation like the bipartisan infrastructure bill we just passed. We've secured funding we need to upgrade our roads and bridges, create good jobs and grow our economy: https://t.co/WxpqmuyZ9O

Rural communities across the Western Slope lack access to reliable public transportation, but we've secured funding to help change that. The bipartisan infrastructure package will work to improve public transportation infrastructure across Colorado.

Do you rely on public transportation to get to work? Coloradans who do spend an extra 74.6% of their time commuting. We're going to change that with funding I've secured to improve public transportation all across Colorado.

We secured an extension of the expanded Child Tax Credit for another year of monthly payments to working families. This tax credit has already kept 3 million kids out of poverty. Now, I'm fighting to make sure we pass it and send it to Pres. Biden's desk: https://t.co/ddLkYsc2Ry

ICYMI: This weekend we passed the largest single federal broadband investment in American history. I fought for this because more than 1 million Coloradans will get help paying for their internet and we'll help 85,000 Coloradans, who currently lack broadband, get internet access.

56 years ago today the Higher Education Act was signed into law, creating Pell Grants and expanding access to higher education for millions of Americans. Today, we're on the cusp of increasing the Pell Grant for more than 68,000 Colorado students who rely on it.

Colorado has 481 bridges and 3,600 miles of highway in poor condition. As a result, our commute times are 9% longer than they were 10 years ago, and our drivers pay an average of $650 every year in extra repairs. We just passed a bill to change that.
PASSED: Our historic bipartisan infrastructure bill just passed the House and is on its way to Pres. Biden's desk. Here's what I fought to include in the bill for Colorado: https://t.co/j7H6XsGZWP

The budget bill I'm fighting to pass includes a 1-yr extended Child Tax Credit which has already kept 3M kids out of poverty. We made sure it includes permanent refundability so kids in the poorest families will be eligible for the full amount forever: https://t.co/sE5aZgLV7w
Wishing a very happy #Diwali to all who celebrate the Festival of Lights!

Of course we ‚Äòought to not ignore‚Äô Colorado. Ignoring Colorado is how we lose our Senate majority. National Republicans are targeting Colorado after their win in Virginia. 

Help us fight back: https://t.co/BGtxqMQaHL https://t.co/wYxm8w0Ebe
Today, I'll be voting for the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

On this day in 2017, Republicans in Congress introduced their tax bill, which cut taxes for big corporations. It's long past time that the biggest corporations pay their fair share. https://t.co/DlMPKcs2B0
Election Day is a good reminder that the Senate needs to pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. Strengthening our democracy and protecting the right to vote is the work of our lifetime.

Some people call elections without presidential races "off years" but our democracy doesn't take time off and neither should we when it comes to voting. Help maintain our democracy: drop your ballot off or vote in person if you haven't done so already. 

https://t.co/KArDXXu8gy

Wishing everyone a happy and safe Halloween! https://t.co/e174ZIj7eh

The expanded Child Tax Credit is helping parents get out of debt. Another reason we need to extend it for years to come. https://t.co/d0t5zVL3QN

It is unconscionable that Latinas have to work until late October of the next year to make as much as what white men made the year before. We have to do better.
#LatinaEqualPayDay
Today is National #PurpleThursday - a day for domestic violence awareness - and yet another day to acknowledge that it's ridiculous we haven't renewed the Violence Against Women Act. #VAWA
Happy birthday to @KamalaHarris from the Bennet girls and me - we all miss seeing you on the campaign trail. https://t.co/KX6UvGC3y2

What I'm reading: the @DenverPost published this article last weekend about how programs, like the expanded Child Tax Credit are providing a lifeline to Colorado families. I'm fighting like hell to extend it at the federal level because poverty is a policy choice. https://t.co/LUqBMMgV59
